intro: Uragoga barteri, commonly known as the Barter's uragoga, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it often grows in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Uragoga barteri is considered a species of conservation concern.
